Squeeze the bottom half of your phone. You can adjust how strongly you need to squeeze.
You can also change the squeeze sensitivity later in Settings
To talk to your Assistant at any time, quickly squeeze the bottom half of your phone, then release

"Turn off Smart Storage?
Smart Storage won't free up space when your storage is almost full."
When storage is almost full, remove backed-up photos and videos. You can still find them in Google Photos.

Back up application data, Wi-Fi passwords and other settings to Google servers
"This will delete all data from your phone's internal storage."
Copy from Android or iPhone® device

"If you don't see some of your data, like SMS messages and photos, you can transfer it to your Pixel by using a cable.
To get started, your Pixel needs to be reset. All data on this phone, including customised settings and content not synced to the cloud, will be deleted."

"On the next screen, you can reset your Pixel. This is the only way to transfer data using a cable.
Once it resets, go through the setup process and choose to bring your data from your previous phone."

"After you reset your phone, you'll need:
• Your previous phone (LINK_BEGINmost phonesLINK_END on Android 5.0+ or iOS® 8.0+ are supported) • A charging or data cable for your previous phone • The Quick Switch Adapter that came with your Pixel"
Extend battery life and optimise charging
%1$s will no longer be paired with any device linked to this Google account
Please select an action to perform
Select what happens when you use Quick Tap. You can change this later in settings.
Let’s try that once more. Quickly tap the back of your phone twice.
You’re ready to start using Quick Tap
Quickly tap the back of your phone twice.
To change the tap strength needed to use Quick Tap, go to settings.
You‘ve just tapped twice on the back of your device, which allows you to use your Assistant on the go. You can customise this gesture in settings.
Take a screenshot, show notifications or start another action in two taps.
Please select an app to open
Select the app that you’d like to open when you use Quick Tap.
Tap back of phone twice to
Select an app to open when you tap the back of your phone twice. If you uninstall the app, Quick Tap turns off until you select a different app.
Select what happens when you open this app using Quick Tap.
Dark theme uses a black background to help keep your battery alive for longer. Dark theme schedules wait to turn on until your screen is off.
To switch in and out of selfie mode in Google Camera, double-twist when you’re in the app.
Downloaded files will be backed up to Google Drive
Fit your face in the inner frame
Capture all angles of your face by removing all the tiles.
Do you want to set up Face Unlock without requiring your eyes to be open? If you set up this way, someone can unlock your phone by pointing it at your face when you’re not aware.
Hold the phone still. Rotate your head. Go slowly.
Keep looking directly at your phone
Turn your head towards the arrow

"Automatically back up device data (such as Wi-Fi passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps) to Google Drive.
When you turn on automatic backup, device and app data is periodically saved to a private folder in Google Drive. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages and photos.
Backup data will not count towards your Drive storage quota. Large files or files that developers have chosen to exclude from the service will not be backed up."
Stop backing up device data (such as Wi-Fi passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps), plus erase all copies on Google Drive?
Show Game Dashboard shortcut in games
Only get notified by important people and apps when playing a game
Maximises frame rate, uses more battery
To access things like your payment methods and boarding passes, press and hold the power button.
Allow installation of apps from sources other than the Play Store

Active Edge on, squeeze for your Assistant
Battery Share is unavailable because Pixel is too hot. Wait for phone to cool down and try again.
Battery Share is unavailable because phone is charging wirelessly
Your phone’s battery will run out faster when using Battery Share. Battery Share works with compatible ear buds, watches, phones and more. For better charging, remove your phone’s case.

"Battery Share works with compatible ear buds, phones and more.
Your phone’s battery will run out faster when using this feature. Battery Share automatically turns off after a few minutes if another device isn’t detected. For better charging, remove your phone’s case and other items that may interfere, like metal objects."
Battery Share is unavailable because Battery Saver is on
Battery Share is unavailable because USB-C device is plugged in
"Charge other devices with your Pixel. Flip your phone over to try."
Unavailable because Pixel is too hot. Wait for phone to cool down and try again.
Unavailable because Battery Saver is on
Unavailable because battery is below sharing level
Place devices on the back of your Pixel
Charge other devices by placing them on the back of your Pixel
Unavailable because USB-C device plugged in

Profile picture, double-tap to open Google Account
On the next screen, rotate your head to capture all angles of your face
On the next screen, hold your phone at eye level
Now you can use your face to unlock your phone or verify that it’s you, like when you sign in to apps or approve a purchase
Setup for limited vision or head motion
When using Face Unlock, your head may need to be more directly in front of your phone.

"You and your child can delete their face model or turn off Face Unlock at any time in Settings. Face models are stored on the phone until they’re deleted.
Learn more at g.co/pixel/faceunlock."
You and your child are in control

"You can delete your face model or turn off Face Unlock at any time in Settings. Face models are stored on the phone until you delete them.
Learn more at g.co/pixel/faceunlock."

"Face Unlock creates a unique model of your child’s face to verify that it’s them. To create this face model during setup, your child will take images of their face from different angles.
When they use Face Unlock, images are used to update their face model. Images used to create their face model are never stored, but the face model is stored securely on the phone and never leaves the phone. All processing occurs securely on the phone."

"Face Unlock creates a unique model of your face to verify that it’s you. To create this face model during setup, you will take images of your face from different angles.
When you use Face Unlock, images are used to update your face model. Images used to create your face model are never stored, but the face model is stored securely on your phone and never leaves the phone. All processing occurs securely on your phone."
Face Unlock can require your child’s eyes to be open to unlock the phone or verify that it’s them. You and your child can turn this option on at any time in Settings.
If your child normally wears glasses, they can wear them during setup.

Looking at the phone can unlock it even when they don’t intend to. Their phone can also be unlocked by someone who looks a lot like them, like an identical sibling, or if someone holds it up to their face.
Face Unlock can require your eyes to be open to unlock the phone or verify that it’s you. You can turn this option on at any time in Settings.
Glasses or lightly tinted sunglasses are OK.

Looking at the phone can unlock it even when you don’t intend to. Your phone can also be unlocked by someone who looks a lot like you, like an identical sibling, or if someone holds it up to your face.
Use your face to unlock your phone or verify that it’s you, like when you sign in to apps or approve a purchase.
To improve performance, you can set up Face Unlock again in Settings

"Try fast setup instead. Keep in mind that your head may need to be more directly in front of your phone when using Face Unlock.
To improve performance, you can set up Face Unlock again in Settings."
Face Unlock setup can’t be completed because the phone is too hot. Try again later when the phone cools down.
